column3: RPG Power Forge can be imported and installed in Unity Editor
RPG Power Forge create a menu in Unity Editor top bar
The Assets Importer can import files to make Unity tiles
The Assets Importer can import files to make Unity prefabs
The Assets Importer can import files to make Unity animation clips
The Assets Importer assemble tiles under a Tiles Collection file
The Assets Importer assemble props under a Props Collection file
The Assets Importer assemble animations under an Animations Collection file
The Assets Importer create the Tiles Collection file at the end of the Tile import process
The Assets Importer create the Props Collection file at the end of the Props import process
The Assets Importer create the Animations Collection file at the end of the Animation import process
The user can import .png file format
The user can import .jpeg file format
The user can import .bmp file format
The user can import .ase file format
The user can import .aseprite file format
The user can import file or directory of files
The user can import file size from 1x1 up to 2048x2048
The user can slice the file
The user can use premade templates to slice file
The user can select a transparency color for the file
The user can select a semi-transparency color for the file
The user can delete empty sprites
The user can choose a collider for a sprite
The user can rename sprites
The user can reposition sprites
The user can cancel the import process
The user can edit any collection file after the initial import
The user can view, select, edit and drop on Scene tiles from any Tiles collection
The user can view, select, edit and drop on Scene props from any Props collection
The user can view, select, edit and drop on Scene custom colliders
The Assets Picker must display assets by category (Actor, Animations, Props, Tiles, Built-In)
The Assets Picker must display assets, in each category, by collection
The Assets Picker must display a warning is the asset can not be place on the Scene
The user can access the Assets Importer directly from the Assets Picker
The Assets Bar must be display at the bottom of the Assets Picker window
The Assets Bar must be display at the bottom of the Assets Importer window
The Assets Bar must be display at the bottom of each Collection window (Tiles, Props, Animations, ...)
The user can zoom-in and zoom-out the assets preview
The user can reset the zoom
The user can change the background color for the assets preview
The user can reset the background color
The Tool Bar is integrated in the Unity Editor
The user can undo an action
The user can redo an action
The user can access the action history
The user can create Actors
The user can access the Assets Picker
The user can access the Assets Properties
The user can access the Actors Statistics
The user can access the Actors Behaviors
The user can toggle the Scene Markers as well as choosing the color
The user can access the Unity Play button
The user can access the Test Controller
The user can access the World Map
The user can access the Database
The user can access the Settings
The user can access the Translation
The user can access the Build
The user can access the Layout
The user can access the Help
